abstract.text: A request to snooze one or more tasks.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object when the user marks one or more tasks for snoozing. The intent object can contain the task information.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an
object with the updated task information.
The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:

Users can ask Siri to snooze tasks in a variety of ways. The table below provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.
忽略买牛奶的提醒事项
过10分钟后再提醒我这个
忽略買牛奶嘅提醒事項
忽略買牛奶的提醒事項
忽略买牛奶嘅提醒事项
نبهني مرة ثانية بذلك التذكير بعد 10 دقائق
Ignore mon rappel pour acheter du lait
Ignora il promemoria comprare il latte
牛乳を買うというリマインダーを無視して
そのリマインダーを10分スヌーズして
우유 사기 미리 알림 다시  알려줘
Ignorar meu lembrete para comprar leite
เลื่อนเตือนซื้อนม
สนูซเตือนความจำอันนี้ไป 10 นาที
Süt almayı 10 dakika sonra tekrar hatırlat

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
A request to fulfill in your app or Intents extension.
A request to snooze one or more tasks.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to snooze all of the tasks.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to snooze all of the tasks.
Initializes the intent object with information about the tasks to snooze and when to snooze them.
Initializes the intent object with information about the tasks to snooze and when to snooze them.
The next time after the current time that triggers a task to snooze.
An array of tasks to snooze.
The handler interface that snoozes tasks in a task list.
Your response to a delete tasks request.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
